Ladies and gentlemen, the response given by the affirmative is highly engaging. It not only shows interest in the conversation, but also adds a new dimension to the discussion. The fact that the runner-up in a presidential election automatically becomes the vice president until 1805 in the US is an interesting piece of information. The affirmative has cleverly used this fact to speculate whether the runner-up was also wealthy enough to be in the top three richest presidents. This response has effectively kept the conversation going and has opened up new avenues for discussion.

topic_chat_history:
hi . i heard an interesting fact recently . did you know that the three richest presidents ever were washington , jefferson , and jfk ? 
 hello , they must have accomplished to people 's satisfactions . 
 i guess so . you know , in different countries a president has different roles and functions . 
 i bet they do . the first president was named president banana in zimbabwe .
topic_chat_fact: until 1805 in the us , the runner up in a presidential election automatically became the vice president
topic_chat_response: yes , i wonder if he was in the top three wealthiest presidents .
